channel.title: 562 loading 659 PROBLEMS :confused:
channel.description: I try to start this server source I recently got, but every time I try to start it a black window shows up saying "The system cannot find the path specified" without abbreviations of course. :o I have all the most recent java's java, java JDK, java JRE; So whats the problem? Can anyone help me? I am willing to rep++!

item.title: 562 loading 659 PROBLEMS :confused:
item.dc:creator: @thurlow92 thurlow92
item.description:
@thurlow92 wrote:

[quote=“whattehp406, post:12, topic:424442”][quote author=thurlow92 link=topic=527099.msg3842395#msg3842395 date=1323358310]

Replace

@echo off title Project DungeonFest 562 loading 659! cd src cd .. "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xms250m -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/* com.rs2hd.Main pause

With this

@echo off title Project DungeonFest 562 loading 659! cd src cd .. java -Xms250m -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/* com.rs2hd.Main pause

Now im getting a “error occurred during initialization of VM could not reserve enough space for object heap”.
[/quote]THEN CHANGE THE FUCKING RESERVED HEAP xmx1024m TO SOMETHING SMALLER[/quote] thanks for the tip I’ll try that; but give your caps lock a break bro. IT FUCKING WORKED MATE! I LOVE YOU (IN A NONE HOMOSEXUAL WAY ORE LIKE A BRO LOVE!) now i need help with running my client -.- dont you just love new comers
Welp the client error is below when i start to load it the cache stay at 0% then says error loading cache and here the java text thats in the edit portion of my run client program

@echo off
java -cp bin;lib/clientlibs.jar;lib/com.jar; client 0 live english game0

Read full topic

Kozs:

CHANGE TO jre7 ITS NOT THAT FUCKING HARD IF YOU UPDATED YOUR JAVA

Appearently it is because i have all the latest java!

item.title: 562 loading 659 PROBLEMS :confused:
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Create System variable

Name: JAVA_HOME
Value: C:\Program Files\Java\yourjava\bin

Edit PATH

<rest of path>;%JAVA_HOME%

Read full topic

item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

How about you go use the search button, or think logicaly.
What does it mean when the system can’t find the path?
Well maybe you have to search where your jre is installed and change the path to that.

item.title: 562 loading 659 PROBLEMS :confused:

item.description:
@thurlow92 wrote:

@echo off
title Project DungeonFest 562 loading 659!
cd src
cd …
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe” -Xms250m -Xmx1024m -classpath bin;deps/* com.rs2hd.Main
pause

Thats whats in there :-/
